metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20368 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-224546354References:Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-lowlatency - 4.4.0-234.268
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-lowlatency - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-kvm - 4.4.0-1114.124
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1150-aws - 4.4.0-1150.165
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1133-aws - 4.15.0-1133.143~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1127-gcp - 4.15.0-1127.142~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-oracle - 4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-234.268').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.124').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1150.165').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1133.143~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1127.142~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
